page.title: 01An overview of Whittlesey
page.content: Whittlesey was until twenty years ago a small market town serving the needs of the area. Recently the town has been expanded by the arrival of a large influx of people mainly from the nearby city of Peterborough. Old fen families still form the nucleus of the population. The towns two 14th century churches and 18th century market cross are the notable architectural structures. The main industries are farming and brick making. An industrial estate on the outskirts of the town serves a larger area of the fens. The shops in town offer a wide range of day to day goods most people shop in Peterborough for larger items. The politics of the area are Liberal but the people of Whittlesey follow all three major parties without any one dominating.
